original_title: Unprofitable Sri Lankan SOEs Excluded from Year-End Bonus
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's State Finance Minister Shehan Semasinge outlined the bonus awarding process for employees of Commercial Corporations, Statutory Boards, and Government Owned Companies (SOEs) in Sri Lanka.
SOE staff will be eligible for bonus payments based on the institution's financial performance in 2022. To qualify, an institution must meet the following criteria:
Distributed at least 30% of its post-tax profits as dividends to the Consolidated Fund, the government's central treasury.
SOEs that fail to meet either of these requirements will not be eligible for profit-sharing bonuses, he said.
Additionally, any SOE that incurs a loss during the financial year 2022 will also be excluded from the process.
